intro: Hispaniella, commonly known as the Spanish bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are herbaceous perennials native to southern Europe and North Africa. The plants typically have showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet, often with a white or yellow throat. Hispaniella species are often found in rocky or dry soils, thriving in Mediterranean climates. Their ornamental value makes them popular in gardens and horticultural collections.
